CatDescriptText: Mr. William Mitchell, elevator technician, 7510 Bennett St. and Mr. Morris Firman, owner of the Rose Bar, 7357 Frankstown Ave., were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "I think that the educational standards should be higher, but children who don't have the ability to learn like others should be put in a special school or in special classes."
TitMainTitle: William Mitchell wearing hat, and Morris Firman, owner of the Rose Bar, posed in front of textured wall
